MajorClaims.MC1: students should study a broad range of subjects from literature to mathematics
MajorClaims.MC2: students should find interesting subjects and acquire general knowledge to prepare higher education at tertiary education

Claims.C1: tertiary education should make students prepare for specialization at university
Claims.C2: it should be to some extent paternalistic to prevent students from avoiding hurdles
Claims.C3: students have to find one or more fields of study in which they are really interested
Claims.C4: high school students should learn broadly and prepare future learning at university
Claims.C5: schools should be responsible for their future and protect them

Premises.P1: They should not decide their future major without trying a broad range of subjects, otherwise they might miss valuable encounter with the subject
Premises.P2: a would-be mathematician student may be strongly intrigued by philosophy and make a success in the field
Premises.P3: students should obtain knowledge from a variety of academic fields
Premises.P4: General education plays a significant role in specialized education
Premises.P5: Science today, for example, is said to be more and more specialized, but in order to solve a problem scientists have to combine knowledge from chemistry to physics
Premises.P6: textbooks used in higher education are labelled particular subjects, in fact they require basic understanding of other subjects
Premises.P7: you sometimes need knowledge about physics to read a text on chemistry
Premises.P8: students have tendency to shun difficulties
Premises.P9: They might avoid tough courses, but instead attend mainly Mickey Mouse courses and enjoy themselves too much
Premises.P10: This might result in limited choices in the future
